definitions.text: a small pouch inside a garment for carrying small articles

examples: the trapped miners found a pocket of air
they dipped into the taxpayers' pockets

definitions.text: (bowling) the space between the headpin and the pins behind it on the right or left
examples: the ball hit the pocket and gave him a perfect strike

definitions.text: a hollow concave shape made by removing something
a local region of low pressure or descending air that causes a plane to lose height suddenly
a small isolated group of people
examples: they were concentrated in pockets inside the city
the battle was won except for cleaning up pockets of resistance

definitions.text: (anatomy) saclike structure in any of various animals (as a marsupial or gopher or pelican)
an opening at the corner or on the side of a billiard table into which billiard balls are struck
